Fields.DialogueText: *KABOOM*
*RATATATAT*
We're under siege! Morganas off the starboard bow!
Leave it to me, Capitano! I've been waiting for any excuse to throw another party!
@BATTLE
Fine fighting out there, Duilio. You must be getting aggravated at me constantly repeating this line.
I could never get tired of being complimented, Capitano. Now then, what kind of celebration is necessary after such a triumphant victory, I wonder...?

Fields.MenuText: It was only a small fry.

Fields.DialogueText: A victory is a victory, Capitano. I will take the same pleasure besting you at Chess or a child at hopscotch.

Fields.MenuText: Another party?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course! As this war drags on and battle memories become blurred, it is important that each success is treated with the same elation as the previous one.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe we could skip the festivities in favor of light paperwork.

Fields.DialogueText: I know that you're just teasing me but that still sent shivers up my spine...
Before we do anything, I need to brief you on the mission ahead.
You received a transmission?
I have. Come by my office in the interim between party prep. It looks like we'll be heading for the Ligurian Sea first thing in the morning. Course should be roughly toward Genoa.
Genoa... I spent some time in reserve floating about Genoa. I'm somewhat familiar with the area and hope to prove an asset to the upcoming mission.
That's the spirit. Dismissed.
Okay, Capitano, I'm all ears.
We'll be conducting reconnaissance on a fleet of Morganas currently on course to enter Genoan waters in the coming weeks.
Reconnaissance?
We have strict instructions to only monitor the Morganas' movements for now. See how much they deviate from an obvious path over the course of several days.
And what good will that do? Should we continue jotting information down in our notebook while the Morgana fleet invades a peaceful port town?
I'm relaying our orders. I'm trusting that the people who gave them know what they're doing.
I'm not sure the people of Genoa would appreciate having their defense described as "playing catch-up."
Hm? Am I mistaken, Capitano? If that is not the order you are asking of me then do speak up.

Fields.MenuText: What would you like me to do?

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing, Capitano. By all means, fall in line.

Fields.MenuText: You think I want to play this so passively?

Fields.DialogueText: I think, were I in your position, I would have not gotten off the radio without making my point clear.
That's enough! However we feel about it, we've been ordered to follow and observe and we're going to follow and observe. We leave for Genoa at daybreak.
Si, Capitano...
*ALARM*
Can you handle that?
Considering this may be one of the only times I'm permitted to do so, I will gladly take up the opportunity.
Duilio, wait. I--
There's no need to explain yourself to me, Capitano. I've already resigned myself to follow your orders to a watery grave if need be. It is the people of Genoa who you should plead your case to.
@BATTLE
It's not like Genoa's defenses are being dismantled. They'll be ready when the Morganas get there.
And you're arguing that those defenses will hold without any loss of life?
And, for the record, I understand the logic. By monitoring their movements, we may learn to predict how future Morganas decide their actions. We can't just be playing catch-up all the time.
You know what I meant.
I know I don't like our orders. I don't like throwing my people to the wolves.
Ah! Capitano! A moment?
What's all this?
I'm trying to think of a theme for my party. Initially, I had thought about throwing a dance but it felt a little too... romantic?
I see. So, you decided to just throw one of your patented ragers?
Sì. Now I'm just trying to pick the right theme...

Fields.MenuText: What ideas have you got so far?

Fields.DialogueText: At the moment, I'm torn between "Luau" and "A Night in Ancient Roma."

Fields.MenuText: What ideas have you rejected?

Fields.DialogueText: I already managed to cut "Under the sea" and "Deep in the Jungle" for being too cliché.

Fields.MenuText: Must we have a theme? I'm sure the crew will be perfectly happy to just let their hair down.

Fields.DialogueText: Considering that I have imposed strict prohibitions of alcohol and debauchery, I need a theme to do a lot of the heavy lifting to get people excited.
I think "A Night in Ancient Roma" is the best choice, after all! Great! Now that's decided, I can move on to...
Hmmmmmm...
Capitano? Why are you making that face?
Just... ancient Rome? Are you sure?
Gah! Capitano, as if I don't have enough on my mind at the moment! The last thing I need is you questioning my judgements.

Fields.MenuText: How about a beach theme?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course you would want a theme centered around water...

Fields.MenuText: Since when was this vessel a dictatorship?

Fields.DialogueText: How dare you?! To compare to the likes of Mussolini and his cohorts... This is by no means a dictatorship! All I ask is that people follow my every word lest a terrible punishment fall upon them.

Fields.MenuText: I just thought perhaps the crew might want to have their say. It is for them, after all.

Fields.DialogueText: I know you're right, I just wish you hadn't said it...
*ALARM*
I can't think with that siren blasting in my ears! Leave it with me, Capitano. I will find a fair and just way to decide on the theme.
@BATTLE
I think I've figured out a way to decide on the party's theme democratically, Capitano.
Let's hear it.
I thought we could host our own miniature Olympic games of sorts!
I don't think we have the facilities for such a thing.
Not entirely sports-related, Capitano. We will have certain events that the crew will have to compete in in pairs.
Why pairs?
One, to encourage teamwork between crew members. And, two, it's quicker to eliminate two people at once!

Fields.MenuText: What kind of events are you planning to include?

Fields.DialogueText: I haven't decided yet. A scavenger hunt could be fun. Although, I plan on competing myself so I'll need to hand over the reins to someone else.

Fields.MenuText: Will you be competing?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course! I will get my theme fairly and squarely!

Fields.MenuText: So, what will happen once only one pair remains?

Fields.DialogueText: That's the best part. The pair will compete in a final competition to determine the single winner!
This all sounds like a lot of effort just to decide the theme of a party.
It can't be helped. If you hadn't gotten involved, the crew would have been perfectly happy living in blissful ignorance.
Now you're REALLY starting to sound like a monarch...
*ALARM*
Quickly, Capitano! We must suppress any outside threats that seek to destroy our peaceful existence.
THAT we can agree on at least!
@BATTLE
What kind of supplies do you need for your party?
Leave it to me, Capitano. The less you know, the better.
Make sure you grab what you need now. We won't be back here again for some time.
Actually, Capitano, I think I'd like to hold off on the party until after our mission is complete. Such a victory deserves to be honored with a party that has had my entire being devoted towards.
As you wish. Still, we'll need some supplies for our recon mission.
I'm happy to pick up necessities like fuel and rations. What about weaponry?

Fields.MenuText: I'm certainly not opposed to the idea. We can never have enough firepower when dealing with Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: I concur. I'd happily unload our entire arsenal into each passing vessel were money not an object.

Fields.MenuText: I think you can handle a few Morganas in your current state.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right, who am I kidding?!
*ALARM*
After we make these final purchases, we should be good to go. I'll handle that so please take care of the Morganas trying to dock.
Aye, aye, Capitano!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I honestly can't remember if anybody owes us enough favors to get us a gun in a hurry.

Fields.DialogueText: I know a good place to look if you-
That said, I don't know that we can expect to find-
How much longer must we wait, Capitano? The fleet is right in front of us!
I've been told to allow them safe passage through these waters en-route to Genoa. We have been given permission to pick off any stragglers lagging behind, however.
This cave does not have the most accommodating smell either... I'd much rather the smell of gunpowder and burning Morgana hulls.

Fields.MenuText: We have to stay here to avoid detection.

Fields.DialogueText: Should every vessel sink beneath the waves, I'm sure they'd have a hard time seeing us as well.

Fields.MenuText: Orders are absolute.

Fields.DialogueText: Now who sounds like they belong in a dictatorship...

Fields.MenuText: We must gather intel on their unadulterated movement patterns.

Fields.DialogueText: I admit, such information may prove helpful in the future. But, I am not willing to let these Morganas run rampant in order to gain such intel.
There, most have them have passed by now.
No harm done this time but how long until those same Morganas commit an act of violence?
I can't deal with this right now. Take out the ships that fell behind and let's continue our tailing.
As you wish, Capitano.
@BATTLE
Keep a close eye on the fleet! We've nearly arrived at Genoa.
Have you always been such a stickler for the rules, Capitano?
I see. I suppose I've never thought much about what a title represents...

Fields.MenuText: You've always had a problem with authority.

Fields.DialogueText: Because those in power have always proven to disappoint me.

Fields.MenuText: Not all those in positions of power are evildoers.

Fields.DialogueText: I understand that. Capitano, you are someone I respect a great deal. However, those sat in their ivory towers playing chess with the men aboard this ship... I can never forgive them.

Fields.MenuText: Must you make me feel worse than I already do?

Fields.DialogueText: I would hope that, in a similar situation, you would pull me aside and try to make me see sense... What else are friends for?
That must be Genoa on the horizon. We'll encroach slowly behind the fleet taking out any strays that veer off the beaten path.
Aye, aye, Capitano.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: It comes with the title.
You have to know what they are if you're going to flout them properly.
Only when an admiral shouts them at me an hour a day for a week.

Fields.DialogueText: In fairness, that comes with being captain.
Oh? *Do* you mean to flout them?
Not lightly. Not if they're reasonable and we can make them work as intended.
When I accepted the title of captain, I entered into a kind of contract with the whole command system. I have to take that seriously.
Capitano! Look, in the distance!
Yeah, that's Genoa! And... what the hell are they doing? Half the defending ships aren't even in position.
Capitano, the Morganas are going to attack! We should intercept them now while we have the chance!
Do we have radio contact with Genoa?
No. Capitano... who are you going to trust?
A seasoned Belle who has been by your side on the front lines for countless battles, or the plan of some nameless, faceless bureaucrat that has never stepped foot onto a ship in their life?!

Fields.MenuText: It's not that simple.

Fields.DialogueText: I can sense the hesitancy in your voice, Capitano! Please, just trust me!
That chink in your otherwise unscathed armor is all the evidence needed to know what we must do.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, dammit. This is going to be a mess.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano, please, I need your full unfiltered permission before I am to act.
Damn it all! Full steam ahead! We're taking out those Morganas before they have a chance to touch Genoan soil!
Si, Capitano!
@BATTLE
Listen, whatever the defensive strategy is here, it was made with the assumption that we'd follow orders and *not* barge in. If we just blunder in and-
Does that mess look like a carefully planned strategy being executed, Capitano?
Genoa looks to be safe and sound!
The men are nearly finished excavating the Morgana wreckage. Take a look at what they found.
Good Lord, how much weaponry is that?!
Enough to take down a peaceful little port town, that's for sure. Your instincts were right on the money.
Hehe, well I have been known to save the day once or twice before.

Fields.MenuText: Duilio, I'm indebted to you.

Fields.DialogueText: Eh? Capitano, no need to go to such lengths.

Fields.MenuText: Thank you. For everything.

Fields.DialogueText: What are friends for?

Fields.MenuText: If it weren't for you, I may have never seen sense.

Fields.DialogueText: Better late than never, Capitano.
I'm worried we may have missed some of the fleet in the chaos. Let's run perimeter around the coast and take out any invading forces.
I worry I may have opened a can of worms in your heart, Capitano...
@BATTLE
Capitano? Are you busy?
Duilio? No, come in.
The crew and I were wondering if you had any plans to take advantage of what Genoa has on hand - rumor has it there's a nice gun looking for a home.

Fields.MenuText: I can't think about that right now...

Fields.DialogueText: Everything all right, Capitano?
I'm just grappling with the aftermath of Genoa. Obviously, our actions - my actions - brought our surveillance mission to a premature end.
Yes, I was there. And?
Hmm... Ah! I've got it! I know just the distraction you need!
Care to enlighten me?
*ALARM*
Try to perk yourself up while I take care of these Morganas, Capitano. I want you in a somewhat decent mood before I unveil my plans!
And, ultimately, nobody's happy. Command's not happy with my insubordination. The Italian government isn't happy to learn that Command was willing to put Genoa at risk-
They weren't told about our surveillance mission? And where it was headed?
Depending on who you ask, they absolutely *weren't* told, or they *were* told and signed off on it and are now shamelessly covering their backsides, or they were told but the translators muffed it.
Regardless, I may be looking at a formal reprimand - and, worse, relations between Italy and the League are worse than they've been in months.
And I don't know how to *fix* it.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Ah, gun rumors. One of life's little joys.
Huh. Noted.

Fields.DialogueText: Ta-dah!
What exactly am I looking at?
*Sigh* Capitano, do you have any sense of delicacy? A girl's heart can only take so much.
Sorry but I really am confused as to what this... is?
I pushed all the tables and chairs to the side to make room for our Olympic games of sorts!

Fields.MenuText: I still don't think there is enough room in here for a hammer throw...

Fields.DialogueText: "Olympics" is just a placeholder. Don't think about it too literally.

Fields.MenuText: Ah, yes, I'd forgotten about that. Now that our mission is over, it's time we decided on a theme.

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly! And where better to compete than in everyone's favorite spot aboard ship?

Fields.MenuText: And you are still competing?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course. I may be democratic but I won't stop fighting for what I believe in!
How do you plan on competing if you already know the answers to certain mystery events?
Oh, don't worry, I pawned off most of the organization to a crew member. That way, I can compete without an unfair advantage. I will get that night in Paris even if it kills me!
Duilio, would you admite that we make a good team?
As long as you listen to every word I say, then I would agree.
I think we'll be able to wipe the floor with the crew as a unit. What say we join forces until the final. That way, we can guarantee our place as the final two.
Interesting... There certainly are no rules against the alliance of, arguably, the ship's two strongest members. You've got yourself a deal, Capitano!
Then, we're allies until the final.
Prepare yourself, Capitano. For me to go easy on you would be an insult. Besides, there's also no guarantee we won't be eliminated earlier. Even I have no idea what games are planned.
*ALARM*
Let's have you prove yourself! I'm not interested in having someone unable to dispatch a fleet of Morganas on my team!
Likewise!
@BATTLE
I can't make heads nor tails of these clues. who on Earth did you designate to make this game? Are you sure we're supposed to be looking down here?
It wouldn't be a scavenger hunt unless the clues were cryptic. Just keep your eyes peeled for anything that looks out of place. My gut tells me that something must be hidden down here.

Fields.MenuText: So, we're just ignoring the clues altogether?

Fields.DialogueText: No one would think of searching the engine room. Something HAS to be down here!

Fields.MenuText: Will all the event planned take up this much brainpower?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm as much in the dark when it comes to this as you, Capitano. For me to know what's coming would instantly put me at an unfair advantage.

Fields.MenuText: Your gut and I aren't that close for me to trust it so much...

Fields.DialogueText: You're welcome to buy me dinner after this as a gift to get better acquainted with it!
Maybe you're right, Capitano.
We are the only people down here, after all. I can't believe we managed to outsmart every other person aboard ship.
May I take another look at the clue?
*ALARM*
Try to decipher it while we take care of these Morganas. The crew will have to stop searching as well while we do battle.
Aye, aye!
@BATTLE
"To the land where trolls reside, that is where you'll claim your prize..."
We're running out of time, Duilio! We only have a few minutes left before we have to regroup in the mess hall!
I've got it!

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure?

Fields.DialogueText: Positive!

Fields.MenuText: Can you explain?

Fields.DialogueText: There's no time!

Fields.MenuText: What if you're wrong?

Fields.DialogueText: Trust me, Capitano!
Where should we go?
To the bridge!
Duilio, I don't mean to doubt you but, we only have time enough to check one more location!
If you're wrong about this, we're out of the competition! We might be forced to attend a *gulp* fancy dress party!
Do you trust me, Capitano?
("Who are you going to trust, Capitano?!" )
("A seasoned Belle who has been by your side on the front lines for countless battles, or a nameless, faceless bureaucrat that has never stepped foot onto a ship in their life?!")
I'm right behind you!
*ALARM*
I'm sure we can spare a second or two to take out these Morganas on the way back as well!
@BATTLE
"Trolls." Somebody wants to give the Swedes on the crew an advantage...
Alla buon'ora.
What is this? A key?
It's only symbolic. Those without a this chocolate key cannot progress to the next round. *Munch munch*
Stop eating it, then!!
It's only one bite, we still have the proof of our success.

Fields.MenuText: How did you know we needed to visit the bridge?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't you know your fairy tales, Capitano? Trolls live under bridges.

Fields.MenuText: You were right, Duilio, this is just the distraction I needed.

Fields.DialogueText: You should learn to trust me more often, Capitano. I'm full of good ideas!

Fields.MenuText: There aren't any other keys here. Perhaps we really were the last ones to arrive.

Fields.DialogueText: The fact that even one key remains means we outsmarted at least one pair, Capitano. You can be proud of that!
*ALARM*
Is that the alarm to signify the game is over or to alert us of Morganas?
Either way, I wouldn't be surprised to see a Morgana or two on the horizon. Let's head to the mess hall and take out any unwanted intruders.
@BATTLE
We make a pretty good team, huh, Capitano?
That we do. It's a shame it has to come down to this.
After a lengthy series of bouts, the final pair has been decided! As expected, your grand final participants are Duilio and the Captain!
*Cheering*

Fields.MenuText: Are you ready for me?

Fields.DialogueText: Like I said before, to go easy on you would be an insult!

Fields.MenuText: I'm thinking... "A naval officer's dream" as my theme for the party.

Fields.DialogueText: You can try to get under my skin however you want, Capitano. My focus will not waver!

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry for what I have to do, Duilio.

Fields.DialogueText: That's my line!
*ALARM*
We can't start anything until we tidy up the surrounding waters! With me!
@BATTLE
As we predicted the two of you would reach this stage, the final competition has been tailored to pit both your wits against each other.
Exciting.
Bring it on!
As the dedicated record keeper aboard ship, scolding us whenever we act out of line, Duilio will pit her knowledge of the crew against the person in charge of us all!
A trivia contest? About crew personnel? Capitano, this isn't looking good for you!
I wouldn't be so quick to write me off. I personally enlisted every member aboard this ship for their diligence and bravery. There is not a single face that I could possibly forget.
We will provide information about a certain crew member. If you think you know who we are talking about, shout out your answer. The first to three points wins.
Got it.
First question. Which crew member is best known for their addiction to chocolate?

Fields.MenuText: Arthur.
David.
Duilio.

Fields.DialogueText: Wrong! Arthur's addiction is to grapes!
Wrong! David's addiction is to sleeping!
I only had one bite of that key! I hardly think that's enough to justify an addiction!
I give up. I don't know.
Duilio?
It's a trick question! No one aboard this ship has an overwhelming fondness for chocolate!
That's correct!
I see how it is... We're playing dirty, huh?
I can assure you, Capitano, I had no role in creating these questions. It's all the luck of the dice roll.
Don't count me out just yet. What's the next question?!
*ALARM*
Morganas! Quicky, Capitano, we must fend them off!
Oh, you'd like that, wouldn't you?!
Capitano, please! This is no time for irrational paranoia!
@BATTLE
Okay, with two correct answers apiece, the victor will be decided with this final question!
Are you ready?
As I'll ever be!
Which member of the crew is responsible for ensuring no alcohol or rambunctiousness can be found aboard the ship--
That's me! It's me!
I wasn't finished yet. Which member of the crew is responsible for ensuring no alcohol or rambunctiousness can be found aboard the ship, per Duilio's preferences.
Huh? Someone asked the crew to adhere to my wishes before I had to ask? I have no idea who could have...
That would be me.
Correct!
Capitano... You did such a thing for me?

Fields.MenuText: It looks like you don't know EVERY crew member as well as you thought.

Fields.DialogueText: I guess not... And I'm starting to regret not making more of an effort to take notice of one crew member in particular...

Fields.MenuText: Prevention is always better than cure is it not?

Fields.DialogueText: I can't begin to imagine the scoldings you've saved me from through such an endeavor...

Fields.MenuText: That's what friends are for.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm truly moved, Capitano.
So, that makes me the winner then.
That it does. And I will respect your decision to have any theme you want.
Then, I would like to proudly announce that out next party's theme will be... "A Night in Ancient Roma."
Capitano... I don't know how much more my heart can take... You don't need to do so much for me...
It's a little unfair that the final question was me as the answer.
That's not really a long-term answer, but never mind.
I'm really just thankful that you part-organized this event and the party to take my mind off things. Consider this an expression of my gratitude.
*ALARM*
Now, what say we create some new memories for the next trivia game?
I'd love to!
@BATTLE
Truth be told, I'm not even that averse to such a theme - I just had visions of it somehow degenerating into another radio argument between you and Cesare over the nature of the Roman Republic.
Ugh. *Her*. Don't worry - she's not invited.
We've been stopped in Genoa now for what feels like a lifetime.
I'm sure my superiors are relishing in every second as they wait for me to stew while deciding my punishment.
Several Morganas have been making their way through the town these past few weeks. I think it's a good idea for us to stick around until the coast is clear.
The people of Genoa have all been so accomodating as well.
Actually, Capitano, I've been meaning to ask you something.
The Genoese people have been offering us supplies while we've been protecting them, and I'm seeing some problems developing.
What kind of problems?

Fields.MenuText: You have my permission to bring on new crew if that'll help.
Don't worry - I don't think we're going to be staying too much longer. The problem will take care of itself.

Fields.DialogueText: Grazie, Capitano.
I understand.
*ALARM*
Morganas! let's deal with them quickly!
Si, Capitano!
@BATTLE
Just bad organization. They're giving us more grain than they can probably spare, and more potable water than we can store. Things like that.
Inefficiencies.
And unnecessary sacrifices on their part. We need better coordination, and that means more of an effort to inventory what we've already got to keep them appraised.

Fields.MenuText: I'll look at it when I can.

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't mean to make more work for you! I just-
Don't open your eyes yet, Capitano.
You've spent nearly three days preparing this party so I'm sure I'll be impressed by the decorations.
Still, I want the reveal to be a surprise!
Just make sure I don't trip over any--ow!
Sorry! Here we are. And... Open!
I'm confused... Vines? Sand? A cutout of... what is that?
But, the larger picture: I felt bad ignoring the other crew members' ideas just because they lost. So, I decided to incorporate every suggestion I received into one huge party! What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: It looks...

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry, Capitano, I was speechless too when I finished it. I know it looks amazing!
Amazing wasn't the exact word I was going to use but, if you're happy, then I'm happy.

Fields.MenuText: Does it have a name?

Fields.DialogueText: "A night under the sea in Roma Antiqua adjacent to a jungle and next to a beach where fancy dress is optional." Or, ANUTSIRAATAJANTABWFDIO for short!

Fields.MenuText: I'm amazed you went to such efforts for everyone.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't think I forgot about you, Capitano. Over there, you can find a desk with some unfinished paperwork atop it! "A Naval Officer's Dream" just became your reality!
*ALARM*
Let's clear out these Morganas to build up an appetite!
I'll inform the crew that we're ready to begin!
@BATTLE
The Temple of Hercules Victor. I was trying to capture Roma before the invention of concrete.
I'm exhausted!
What a party! I've never seen a group of sober people so lively!
And everyone knew not to push themselves too far, which I appreciated.
I informed the crew that we wouldn't tolerate such behaviour.
Did you have a nice time, Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: I enjoyed my stay at "Naval Officer Island" as much as any senior officer I know would have.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad to hear it!

Fields.MenuText: This Frankenstein of a party worked out surprisingly well.

Fields.DialogueText: Eh? Capitano, you said before that you said it looked good!

Fields.MenuText: Thanks to you.

Fields.DialogueText: It was your selfishness that lead me to this decision. I should be thanking you.
These past few days have been so much fun. I can barely remember why I was feeling so--
*BZZZZZZ*
Is that...?
My time of reckoning has come at last.
Should they dismiss you, know that I will never follow another captain for as long as I--
I appreciate the sentiment, but if I get my knuckles rapped, it's fine. I'll take the consequences of my actions.
*ALARM*
I'm more worried about smoothing things over between Italy and the League. I don't want to be responsible for breach there - not at this stage of the war.
If you wouldn't mind.
Of course, Capitano. Good luck.
@BATTLE
Whatever you need from me, Capitano...
Capitano? Are you finished with your--
Signore, I don't know how to say it more clearly. We were monitoring the Morganas to learn about them, to fight them better. You know as well as I do how vital that is.
Yeah. Yeah, if I did receive orders like that, you can be damn sure I'd disobey them. And my superiors know that too. My mission - the Fleet's mission - is protection.
*Smiling*
I too will be interested to see what information the final report yields... And good day to you too, Signore! Try not to injure yourself hanging up the radio!
Capitano, are you okay?

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, they weren't too happy.

Fields.DialogueText: If it makes you feel better, I have nothing but respect for the way you acted.

Fields.MenuText: Was I a little too... vocal?

Fields.DialogueText: Better to be hung for a sheep than a lamb.

Fields.MenuText: I meant every word of that, you know?

Fields.DialogueText: I know. I couldn't keep myself from smiling.
They've received our report up until we managed in combat, and independent reports will follow up. Command'll get back to me with their findings - alongside my punishment - in due time.
Nothing we can do but wait, then.
*ALARM*
These Morganas should be able to kill some time.
@BATTLE
Whatever reprimands I receive, they're for compromising that objective, not for saving your city. You know that. And you know this war is bigger than any one commander.
And, for the record, my Belle would beaten the hell out of me if I'd even considered letting Italy down.
Yeah, most of the big calls of the day are done. The League may or may not put a black mark in my record, but tempers are definitely cooling. That's the main thing.
It took some doing, I gather. I heard the end of that last call.
Capitano! You should be receiving a call any minute about--
Mhm... Yes, I understand...
Oh, sorry... please continue...
You found what...? Interesting... Then that would mean... I see... No, thank YOU... At once, Admiral.
So? Are you being terminated?

Fields.MenuText: Would you be sad to see me go?

Fields.DialogueText: You are my dear friend... Must you probe for such an obvious answer?

Fields.MenuText: What do you think?

Fields.DialogueText: By the look on your face, I'd say it's good news.

Fields.MenuText: I am.

Fields.DialogueText: You're a terrible liar, Capitano. That beaming smile gives you away!
Based on the reports we submitted containing the Morganas' travel and ammunition use, it's agreed that they planned to attack Genoa. It was a long-term goal, and they proceeded in a linear fashion.
As we suspected all along.
While it's widely agreed that it would have been ideal if the Genovese forces had repelled the attack - leaving us to follow the Morganas to whever they went next...
So, what you're saying is...?
Well, that I'm not in trouble. And that *your* instincts saved the lives of a good chunk of the Genovese civilian population and their infrastructure, Duilio. You should be very proud of yourself.
No, Capitano. I just gave my opinion. You were the once forced to me the dubious call. The praise should be all yours.
Either way, it's nice to know that I-- WE did the right thing.
Here, here!
*ALARM*
How about a victory lap?
I'm right behind you!
@BATTLE
But, again, concrete evidence of a degree of organization we just didn't see in the early weeks of the war.
But which wouldn't have surprised anyone who's spent any time fighting the enemy in person.
Just take the win and let me continue, okay?
Bene.
... it was appropriate for us to intercede when the safety of Genoa was at stake.
And the best guess is that we probably saved hundreds of lives.
Capitano! Capitano!
No need to shout, I'm in here.
Word has spread to the people of Genoa that they were to be the target of an attack and it was YOU who saved them!
The crew just can't seem to keep their mouths shut, can they? We'll be departing soon, could they not have held their tongues for a few more days?
Regardless, the people of Genoa would like to personally thank you for your efforts!

Fields.MenuText: I do not require thanks for doing my duty.

Fields.DialogueText: I understand, Capitano, but the people would be insulted were we to set sail without hearing them out!

Fields.MenuText: This is embarrassing, isn't it?

Fields.DialogueText: If we are to come out of this war unscathed, I would hope to be put in even more embarrassing situations than this in the future!

Fields.MenuText: Very well, if they insist.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll inform the masses!
*ALARM*
The Morganas have been growing thinner by the day. By the time we leave, they should be all but wiped out.
We can leave with our heads held high knowing we did the right thing.
@BATTLE
Thank you, everyone, for joining us today. We'll soon be setting sail but, before we depart, the captain would like to say a few words to you, and to all the people of Genoa.
I'll keep this brief. I just want to say that your thanks, though appreciated, are unnecessary. All of us here would have felt the damage to your port and your city as damage to ourselves.
When faced with such an abhorrent enemy, it can be difficult to see the light at the end of the tunnel.
But we cannot let the darkness take root. We must search for any clues that might help us find the key to salvation!
Capitano...
Whether we are fighting back against invaders from the sea, or invaders on out doorstep seeking to use others for personal gain, we cannot let the flame of hope die out!
We will soon be returning to the ocean and, when we do, YOU will be the ones to keep Genoa safe! You have my blessing to tear any invaders a new one!
*Cheering*
Oh, and one final thing...

Fields.MenuText: Don't tell anyone I said this!
We will be victorious!
A round of applause for my partner and friend, Duilio! I could have done nothing without her!

Fields.DialogueText: *Cheering*
Capitano... Well said!
Now, we must return to the sea.
Several Morganas are blocking our exit. They should be the last in the Genoan area.
Let's take them out!
@BATTLE
This enemy we're facing isn't fighting in self-defense. They're not fighting for the rights of their people - any people.
They don't want to feed their children, they don't want us to respect their religion - they don't seem to have any motive beyond simply wanting to kill us and take our things.
Ah?

We're under attack! Should we monitor the enemy while our ship dips beneath the waves, Capitano?! It may prove useful for the ships that follow us to know at what exact water volume we beging sinking!
No need to tease me, Duilio, I've leanrned my lesson. Full steam ahead!
@BATTLE
We've been through so much these past weeks, haven't we, Capitano. What was your favorite part?

Fields.MenuText: The party!

Fields.DialogueText: It was a lot of fun, wasn't it? The theme managed to appeal to everyone!

Fields.MenuText: The competition events!

Fields.DialogueText: Winning is always fun, haha!

Fields.MenuText: Talking back to my superiors!

Fields.DialogueText: I've never seen you so emotive! I was quite shocked!
The road ahead looks to be long and arduous, Duilio. Are you prepared?
So long as trust each other, there is nothing we can't do!
Then let's set sail into the sunset!
